intro: Erigeron piloso-villosus, commonly known as the hairy fleabane, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features hairy stems and leaves, which contribute to its common name. It produces small, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. Erigeron piloso-villosus is often found in open fields, meadows, and disturbed soils, thriving in full sun.
